meanings.definition: A member of an ancient Celtic priesthood.
meanings.sent1: The druid led the ceremony with wisdom and reverence.
meanings.sent2: The druid performed rituals in the sacred grove.
meanings.sent3: The druid joked that even the trees listened to his prayers.
meanings.sent4: Her presence in the forest was like that of a druid communing with nature.
meanings.sent5: The druid's cloak billowed in the wind as he chanted ancient verses.

meanings.sent1: As a druid, she honored the cycles of the moon and sun.
meanings.sent2: The druid celebrated the solstice with a gathering of like-minded individuals.
meanings.sent3: The druid's modern twist on tradition brought laughter to the group.
meanings.sent4: In her heart, she felt like a druid connected to the earth's energy.
meanings.sent5: The druid's staff was adorned with symbols of the elements.

meanings.definition: A person who is knowledgeable in nature-based spirituality.
meanings.sent1: The druid shared stories of the forest's secrets with the children.
meanings.sent2: In her garden, she felt like a druid attuned to the earth's whispers.
meanings.sent3: The druid's advice on plant care was always sought after.
meanings.sent4: His eyes held the wisdom of a druid who had seen many seasons pass.
meanings.sent5: The druid's connection to the land was evident in every step she took.

meanings.definition: To act as a druid in a play or performance.
meanings.sent1: She will druid the role of the wise elder in the school play.
meanings.sent2: The actors practiced how to druid their lines with authenticity.
meanings.sent3: He druided with such passion that the audience was captivated.
meanings.sent4: In the play, he will druid the part of the mystical forest guide.
meanings.sent5: To druid effectively, one must embody the essence of nature in their performance.
